title: UK weather forecast: Britain braces for five days of rain and 70mph winds
text:

Britain will be hit with flooding, torrential downpours and travel chaos as the country braces for five days of rain.

Power failures will also hit parts of the UK in the coming days - and the Met Office has issued a severe yellow weather warning.

The weather alert stretches from London right up to central Scotland with only the west of the country escaping.

Heavy bursts of rain are likely from tomorrow through to Wednesday and the north and west parts of the country can expect coastal gales.

(Image: PA)

Brits can expect spray and flooding on roads and delays or cancellations to train and bus services. Some communities may also be cut off by flooded roads.

The weather warning is in place until 6pm tomorrow.

According to The Met Office the jet stream will remain strong which will drive areas of low pressure to the northwest of the country.

This will bring another "cool and unsettled week" with spells of rain and strong winds.

The Environment Agency said teams were out and ready to respond to flooding.

Alex Burkill, a meteorologist at the Met Office said we could see about 40 to 50mm of rain fall tomorrow.

He said: "Most of that could fall within six hours."

But Wales and parts of Northern Ireland can expect a slightly brighter day and maybe even some sunshine.

(Image: PA)

Unfortunately after the heavy rain tomorrow, the "unsettled regime" looks set to continue later in the week.

There will be blustery showers from Monday to Thursday.

Much of the wet weather this past week has been caused by the passing of Hurricane Lorenzo.

The storm whipped up frighteningly powerful winds of 165mph as it blasted its way across the north Atlantic.

Two weeks' worth of rain could hit parts of the UK on Sunday as a band of rain from the Atlantic moves over Britain.
description: A severe weather warning is in place with 40-50mm of rain expected to fall in just six hours.
